key_responsibilities: serves as the congressman’s liaison with the community, local organizations and government agencies
staff and/or represent the congressman at events
advise the congressman about local issues
help organize community based meetings and events
implement proactive constituent outreach program
prepare Member for speeches and meetings
draft correspondence
requirements: Strong written, communication, analytical, and organization skills
ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds
Minimum two (2) years of experience working directly with the community
Knowledge of the Asian Pacific Islander communities
Good computer skills, including proficiency and experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
thorough understanding of government agencies and structure (local, county, state and federal)
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
ability to meet strict deadlines, balance multiple projects simultaneously and work under pressure
positive attitude, commitment to excellence, upbeat demeanor and flexibility
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

key_responsibilities: manage and prepare the Member’s schedule
respond to all scheduling requests
arrange the Member’s travel
provide and assist with local travel
draft and manage Member correspondence
provide assistance to the Member in other areas
order and maintain office supplies
maintain office personnel files
work closely with the staff assistant and interns
requirements: knowledge of the Congressional work setting
comfort working one-on-one with the Member and his Chief of Staff
strong experience with office technology management and troubleshooting, for both PC’s and Apple products
Strong written and oral communication skills
ability to work in an extremely fast paced office
flexibility to work late hours on short notice
owning or having consistent access to a car

key_responsibilities: handle a diverse policy portfolio including defense, veterans, foreign affairs, healthcare, and other issues
developing proactive legislative initiatives
tracking legislation
drafting correspondence and statements
representing the Member in meetings
requirements: in-depth knowledge of the legislative process
ability to work well under pressure

key_responsibilities: tracking legislation and other developments to brief the Member on floor votes and pending legislative matters
developing and implementing policy initiatives in line with office goals
meeting with constituents and other interest groups
coordinating with DC and district staff regarding legislation, messaging, and events
requirements: ability to work effectively in a fast paced environment

office: Established Member of Congress from the southeastern US
key_responsibilities: driving member legislative initiatives
briefing the member on all policy matters
meeting with relevant public interest groups and constituents
providing real time vote recommendations
assisting the Chief of Staff on policy matters
requirements: working knowledge of all current issues debated in the House

key_responsibilities: handle a diverse portfolio of policy issues with a primary focus on legislation before the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee
developing and advancing legislative initiatives
preparing briefing materials
drafting constituent correspondence and floor statements
coordinating with the communications team and district staff on messaging and events
building and maintaining stakeholder relationships
requirements: ability to be proactive, resourceful and thrive in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: draft legislation
analyze bills
meet with constituents concerning policy matters
requirements: strong commitment to individual liberty, economic freedom, and the defense of the Constitution
background in economics and some policy experience

key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s D.C. calendar
District calendar
coordinating logistics and travel arrangements
overseeing administrative work for the Member
requirements: ability to adapt to changing circumstances
ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: Acts as the representative for the Congressman within his or her area of responsibility including answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, verbal communications with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
Informs the Congressman and the District Director of all happenings in his or her assigned issue areas by screening district media sources and interacting with constituents
Handles casework assignments
Acts as a liaison to local, state and federal officials and other persons or groups to form effective relationships for the Congressman
Assesses casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations to the District Director and Scheduler
Monitors scheduled district meetings for the Congressman with constituents
Works well under pressure and handles stress
Works a flexible schedule including long hours, nights and weekends
Performs other duties as assigned
requirements: Strong oral and written communication skills
Thorough knowledge of local, state and federal agencies and departments
Knowledge of all issues and events in the district in which the Congressman is involved
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in fulfillment of casework responsibilities
Knowledge of office policies, practices, procedures, and computer applications

position: Legislative Assistant, or Senior Legislative Assistant
key_responsibilities: handle work on the Financial Services Committee
requirements: substantial experience with financial services issues
strong writing and oral communication skills
ability to work well with others

key_responsibilities: briefing the Member on floor votes and other pending legislation
requirements: expertise on issues involving healthcare, education and veterans’ affairs

key_responsibilities: Serve as an official representative for the Member throughout communities in the District
Act as liaison with federal, district, and local government agencies, political officials, and other community organizations to form effective relationships for the Member
Monitor and update the Member and District Director on district and local issues of importance
Staff and provide logistical support for scheduled district meetings and events for the Member
Assess local and casework related issues for problems requiring possible legislative action; make recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
Answer casework correspondence and verbal communications with constituents
Provide casework assistance to constituents in a timely and efficient manner; proactively follow up on all open cases until a resolution is reached
requirements: background in and/or understanding of military/veteran issues
Ability to work non-traditional hours, including nights and weekends, if needed
Excellent written (English and Spanish) and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work with staff at all levels, work well under pressure and be detail oriented
Possess an understanding of the federal legislative process
Ability to quickly learn about key issues and events in the district for which the Member is involved
valid California driver’s license with the ability to travel as needed

office: House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs Chairman Jeff Miller
key_responsibilities: oversee the implementation of the committee’s communications strategy
requirements: record of accomplishment with internal and external communications, press relations and social media

key_responsibilities: writing and editing press releases, op-eds, talking points, enewsletters, and franked communications
developing content for and managing website and social media
coordinating telephone town halls
directing interns on communications projects
pitching stories to the press
requirements: demonstrated abilities in digital media and communication
ability to work quickly and calmly under pressure
familiarity with water, agriculture, military, and transportation policy

key_responsibilities: managing office calendars and visitor access to Member and staff in front office
organizing and tracking invitations, speaking engagements, travel reservations and other requests for the Member
coordinating with district staff
maintaining administrative demands
requirements: ability to work well under pressure and on short deadlines
availability to assist the Member outside of regular business hours
strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Previous Capitol Hill operational and/or scheduling experience
